title: Please Riot, Patch 6.17 broke the game for a lot of people.
body:
Please please please stop with the copy paste in every single lag thread about checking our connection or ISP's routing. The game worked completely fine before the patch, no lag, no issues. After the patch, insane packet loss in every game, champions blinking around, can't see projectiles, "Attempting to reconnect" appearing after ms suddenly jumping to 500.

Instead respond to these threads with a "we are aware of the issue and working on solving it", please.
The game is unplayable as of now for me and a bunch of other people and we need to know when we can launch and enjoy the game again.

replies.body: These cases need more information and investigation through troubleshooting, and I need this help to rule out possibilities.  For your specific case, the kind of input delays you are reporting are usually due to network or packet loss issues.  As a first step, I'd like you to run a [log reader](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/209765743-Connection-Troubleshooting-Log-Reader) of the games with these spikes so we can analyze the situation.  Let me know!

I've been getting very regular bursts of packet loss and ping spikes lately.

This is from my latest game, played on the 30th August. http://i.imgur.com/WndKN5c.png

And this is one from the 23rd, before the  patch.http://i.imgur.com/bYPUthg.png

Also, from the 24th the day of the patch. http://i.imgur.com/RmJMPlE.png

Hope this helps!

Edit: disregard me. Reset my router for the second time, seems to have worked this time. Sorry to bother you.

http://imgur.com/a/rl1R8

Added 3 screenshots, one before the patch with stable 120~ ms and 0% packet loss (I'm EU playing on NA account, hence the higher ping) and two after the patch where "MAJOR ISSUES" are the only right words to use.

This has happened at least once before that I was there to experience, which also happened after a patch was released. That happened one or two seasons ago and at that point I took a break from playing and once I came back again it was fixed.

Thanks for the information on this!  There certainly appears to be a network issue causing some major packet loss, and honestly a big part of that might be the long distance reaching the NA server in combination with how your ISP is getting there.  The results of the log reader should have provided some steps to fix this, but I also recommend checking out our [connection issues](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues).  Make sure to go through each step, and specifically configuring your dns.  Hopefully this will help improve your connection to what it was before, but keep in mind that it can't exceed the expectation of your connection travelling such a far distance.

There is nothing that I can do to fix this issue, not now and not when it happened before and this is not caused because I am EU, it happens to NA playing on NA servers aswell. This is 100% on you guys, that is all I can say.

Submit a [support ticket](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) over to us so we can take a close look.  Any additional logs via [hextech repair tool](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/224826367) can help as well.  We'll respond as soon as possible!
uploaded my logs, average ping 181, average of 25% packet loss

Yea, I keep looking in these posts with ping issues and Riot employees commenting that it's most likely from the players end. I've ran through all possibilities and nothing works. My ping always sky rockets around the 2 minute mark in laning, then I reconnect or let is stabilize. Then it stays that way for maybe 6-7 minutes and starts again. Other players have had this happen in my games but not everyone in the game.

My last few games. http://imgur.com/a/eUNm6
I've done all the steps on that page as well as run the hextech repair tool. These are games after that, no change.
Its been happening to me too.
I was thinking the same thing. It's not on my end.
